attributes.action: Call for Government to fund rural school transport
attributes.background: we call for the government to fund all rural home to school transport across the country instead of local councils being responsible for setting their own privatized school bus services, which is causing financial hardship to working families, and severe disruption to public services.
attributes.additional_details: local councils have been given responsibility for setting school bus services, which has allowed them to privatize the bus routes and hike up the prices to almost £1000 per child,per year in some cases. This is causing severe financial hardship to low income families who do not qualify now under the new 'nearest school' changes, as opposed to the old 'catchment school' agreement.we would like all children to travel to school for free, all current school bus services also need improvement.

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time. This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods.

The proposed Benefit would be funded by introducing a levy of 50% of UK Profits on companies who move their operations - in whole or in part - outside the UK.

attributes.action: Due to its defence policy this house has no confidence in the government.
attributes.background:
The first duty of any government is the defence of the realm and its people.  The reports of the Commons Defence Select Committee and of Sir John Parker are ignored.
The Army Reserve is under strength.
In the UN we should be able to “Speak softly and carry a big stick”.
attributes.additional_details:
The Type 45's have not had their defects rectified. Our fleet is not able to defend our trade or undertake our world-wide duties. 
The army is  a militia.  Personnel have despicably been made redundant immediately qualifying for pension.  The RAF has too few A/C and no maritime reconnaissance capability.

attributes.action: Lower Child Support where no Staying Contact, unless Child Protection issues.
attributes.background: Welfare Benefit Reforms mean the parent getting Child Benefit after separation can access the systems to get up to the income the law says they need.Child Support is not counted for means tested things, but more has to be paid if there is no Staying Contact, encouraging ex partners to try to stop it
attributes.additional_details: In the past 3 months there has been several cases on the Separated Dads Forum, where ex partners are opposing staying contact, just to get more Child Support. Some have even gone to the extent of false reports to Police/Social Services what then stopped contact for months, while investigation is ongoing. Children need both parents, and the no staying contact amount should only be paid in extreme cases due to Child Protection/Welfare. The starting amount should be based on 53-104 nights contact.

attributes.action: Free sun cream for all school children
attributes.background: I have been recently been diagnosed with skin cancer, being only 28 this has come as a bit of a shock. being a red head, fair skinned , and freckly I always kept an eye on skin changes but you still think it wont happen to you. This then flagged up and made me take notice the price of sun cream.
attributes.additional_details:
Every child should have access to sun cream, especially march-October, teachers, anybody in a position of care to a child should be allowed to apply sun cream where they see fit.
Sun damage ages the skin but also raises the risk of skin cancer, one of the most preventable cancer. I believe all school children should receive a 'sunstart' pack containing a sun hat, sun cream, and information sheet, a bottle of water , and an activity pack. FREE SUN CREAM FOR ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN.

attributes.action: Provide and fund a home education for 16-19 yrs olds with chronic conditions
attributes.background: The age of participation is 18 but for those with chronic conditions such as PoTS, CFS/ME, EDS there is no funding for home tution. If they fail their GCSEs they are unable to retake, there is not the provision to do A Levels at home. Few have an EHCP as it is considered health not education.
attributes.additional_details:
In a letter from Edward Timpson MP dated 5-11-15, he states that section 68, Education & Skills Act 2008 requires local authorities to make available support that will encourage & assist the participation young people in education or training up to the age 19. 
Without an EHCP there is no transition into post 16 education, LEAs are not made accountable for those unable to attend education or work as an apprentice. LEAs must be held accountable to provide education and/or apprenticeship for all.

attributes.action: Provide Orkambi for Cystic Fibrosis patients in England.
attributes.background: Orkambi (ivacaftor and lumacaftor) is a gene therapy based drug used to help treat CF for the most common gene (deltaF508). Use in Cystic patients can reduce lung function decline from 2.3% annually to 1.3% a significant improvement over the course of a cystics life.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37795460

attributes.action: Stop MPs banning the RSPCA from prosecuting those who are cruel to animals.
attributes.background: A group of MPs are trying to stop the RSPCA from prosecuting those who starve, beat, stab, burn and abuse poor defensless animals.
attributes.additional_details: The RSPCA is paid for by public donations (animal lovers) and not through taxes therefore has nothing to do with MP's. With over 200 years of experience the RSPCA does a fantastic job at protecting the welfare of animals including prosecuting those who are cruel to them. Don't let MP's take this power away so that animals become a lesser priority. Who else do they have?

attributes.action: Open an enquiry into the abuse of psychoactive substances (NPS) within prison
attributes.background: The growing use of new and largely non-detectable psychoactive substances (NPS) is leading to increased violence, bullying, debt and medical emergencies requiring hospitalisation. We demand a thorough enquiry immediately to investigate the claims made in the Secret Lives of Prisons Documentary
attributes.additional_details:
People in prison, prisoners and staff, are
less safe than they were five years ago. This year more
prisoners were murdered, killed themselves, self harmed
and were assaulted than ever before
Serious assaults in prison have more than
doubled in the last three years. 
Rates of self-harm are at the highest level ever
recorded. There were 32,313 self-harm incidents in
2015—a nearly 40% rise in just two years.
We believe this is a direct result of overcrowding and  NPS. We demand an immediate enquiry

attributes.action: High sentences on gang bullying
attributes.background: As parents we need the help from the government to reduce the the amount of gang bullying on the streets where there is filming taking place of these children being beaten up for the fun of it. With a strong punishment now in court for this kind of behaviour.

attributes.action: Don't leave the EU without guarantees of Vote Leave's promises
attributes.background:
The Vote Leave campaign said the UK could have: 1. £350 million a week back from the EU, for spending on the NHS, 2. Control of migration policy, and 3. Continued access to the single market.
We call on HM Government not to leave the EU without cast-iron guarantees to meet these three key pledges.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that leaders must be accountable, and that promises to voters matter. If and when HM Government invokes Article 50, the UK will have to leave the EU within two years, even if it cannot get a good deal. Any EU country could prevent the UK joining again. We call on HM Government not to leave the EU, and not to invoke article 50, without guarantees that these Vote Leave pledges will be met.

attributes.action: Private companies doing work for the NHS should display their logos on site.
attributes.background: Much of the NHS's work is done using private companies under the NHS logo.  It would inspire confidence in patients and their families and show responsibility if these companies were required to show their logos alongside that of the NHS in departments where their services are used.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the dredging of rivers to reduce flooding risk...
attributes.background: The EU directive effectively stopped rivers being dredged causing flash flooding because of the reduced capacity of rivers and their inability to contain run off. Now we are no longer at the behest of the EU we can reintroduce this effective means of flood control...

attributes.action: Make stillbirth training mandatory for student midwifes before work placements
attributes.background: Many midwifes end up going out onto placement in hospitals without any experience or knowledge in how to deal with the emotional effects of stillbirth on parents. By making stillbirth training mandatory it will improve services provided to the parents they are dealing with in maternity wards.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory all authorities scan all domestic pets!
attributes.background: Bodies working in the animal sector, such as vets & shelters, usually scan for a microchip. However this is not compulsory and there are other authorities who will not scan at all such as a number of councils. All authorities working with animals, by law, should be required to scan all domestic pets
attributes.additional_details:
Microchips in domestic pets were introduced so, should an animal be lost or found injured, an owner could be located and notified. 
There is no current legislation which states any authority who comes in to contact with animals has any legal obligation to scan them. 
Dogs and cats can be collected & disposed of by councils without having been scanned and owners will never be informed. This leads to great distress and upset when the owner has a right to be informed of the fate of their companion

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there

attributes.action: Equality for mental health
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, have joined together to mount a campaign aimed at persuading the Government to help reduce the suffering of those with mental ill health by increasing investment into the provision of mental health services.
attributes.additional_details:
As ministers make final decisions on the Spending Review, we urge them to treat mental health equally with physical health. We ask for the same right to timely access to evidence based treatment as those with physical health problems.

We accept, this will require additional investment in mental health services. But we are strongly persuaded that investment in mental health services will lead to significant returns by reducing the burden on the NHS through the improved wellbeing of our citizens.

attributes.action: Stop all Funding to the EU
attributes.background: After the referendum result to leave the EU the UK will no longer be involved in decision Making within the EU as such all funding of the EU should cease

attributes.action: maternity to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 85-95
attributes.background: If a minimum sallary is £1200 a month it is impossible to survive with £500 a month in maternity period. The private rent is so expensive not to mention utilities and food, the maternity should be paid for 1 year like other countries and with a % of 85-95 of the sallary.

attributes.action: Make sharing content of disabled children with the intent to humiliate illegal.
attributes.background: The number of hate crime incidences against disabled people are increasing. This is fuelled by sharing disparaging social media content. Disabled children often don't have a voice to defend themselves so should have special protection against behaviour which feeds dangerous negative attitudes.

attributes.action: Stop the M56 new junction 11a scheme.
attributes.background: Highways England are planning to introduce a M56 junction 11a. The plans squeeze a new junction between 2 existing junctions that are no more than 4 miles apart. No evidence has been offered by Highways England to justify it's need or cost. It would have a severe impact on several local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Having reviewed the existing plans many residents are sceptical about the motive for this junction. They believe that the new junction would only serve to channel traffic towards a new Mersey Toll Bridge crossing (currently under construction) and will do nothing to ease the serious congestion issues that already exist between Junction 12 and 14.

attributes.action: Control the population of seabirds for health, safety and environmental reasons
attributes.background: The Scarborough News is campaigning for a change in the law to manage the populations of seabirds including kittiwakes in the interest of public safety, health and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of control over the seabird population has led to dangerous food-grabbing swoops on men, women and children, and the creation of a serious scale of mess and stench of droppings in shopping areas, and on pavements, shop buildings and the general environment.

attributes.action: Prevent councils from moving homeless people into other areas without permission
attributes.background:
Private companies are buying up housing stock, evicting the tenants, then offering the properties to the local council as temporary accommodation for the homeless.

If the council says "no," the firm offers the properties to another local authority to move their homeless people into.
attributes.additional_details:
In Peterborough, a private firm evicted tenants and their families from 74 homes on a single estate then offered the properties to Peterborough City Council as temporary accommodation.

The firm told the council that if it did not take up the properties, they would be used by a London borough for its homeless people.

This practice is going on around the country and is causing misery for many people. 

See:

http://tinyurl.com/zf9atnv

http://tinyurl.com/zsyc6x6

http://tinyurl.com/hro3dqp

attributes.action: Transfer reserved power for Drug Classification to the Northern Ireland Assembly
attributes.background: Drug classification powers remain reserved to Westminster. The present system of drug classification is based on historical assumptions, not scientific assessment. The Scottish Government want to consider reforming laws to allow the medicinal use of cannabis. Northern Ireland should do the same
attributes.additional_details: There is strong evidence that medical cannabis helps with chronic pain; spasticity (common, disabling and painful after stroke or brain injury and common in those suffering from multiple sclerosis, as examples); for nausea and vomiting, especially during chemotherapy; and for the management of anxiety. It is also useful in sleep disorders, for appetite stimulation, fibromyalgia, post-traumatic stress disorder, severe childhood epilepsies, bladder problems and even for control of some cancers.

attributes.action: Demand MPs to hold an anonymous poll on the EU Referendum (Stay/Leave)
attributes.background: MPs need to have their say on the EU Referendum led by their conscience to do the best for Britain. First, it is better to hold an anonymous poll so that MPs are not influenced by career ambitions of being re-elected (support their electoral area outcome even if they are fundamentally against it).
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum had an advisory role. The outcome was compromised by misleading information from the Leave campaign, topics included: NHS, immigration, free movement and the cost of the UK’s EU membership. Millions of people didn't know what they voted for. 
This anonymous poll is designed to help MPs understand where they stand and proceed accordingly as the period of uncertainty is unquestionably bad for the economy.
MPs are required to vote in Britain's best interest by law.

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for politicians to lie to the public.
attributes.background: We cannot call ourselves a functioning democracy if our democratic decisions are taken based on lies and deceptions. We therefore demand that any politician who lies to or misleads the public be held legally accountable, and a new agency be set up to monitor political advertising and promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that any politician who lies for personal or political gain should: 
1/ Be removed from their position
2/ Be banned from all public offices for a minimum of ten years
3/ Pay a fine based on the severity of the crime and their ability to pay
Any legislation enacted based on the lie must to be cancelled.
An independent body must be set up to monitor politicians to this effect, and also to monitor political advertising and campaign materials, similarly to the Advertising Standards Agency.

attributes.action: Create a specific offence to protect Nurses, Paramedics & Medical volunteers.
attributes.background:
This offence should be created to enable prosecution for anyone who assaults Medical Staff. This offence can be committed anywhere medical personnel are working. This must be extended to not only to NHS trusts, but also voluntary organisations and private providers.

Medical Staff are life-savers
attributes.additional_details:
Paramedics have threatened with death, spat at, kicked, punched and had knives pulled on them as they answer emergency calls.

Ambulance trust’s are now calling on magistrates to get tough with offenders convicted of assaulting 999 teams, to protect frontline medics from violence and abuse.

There is no deterrent. If people knew they would get a guaranteed prison sentence for attacking medical staff, they would probably think twice about doing it.

attributes.action: Introduce Land Tax or similar reform so super rich can't avoid Inheritance Tax
attributes.background:
PM Mrs May said in her first speech "When it comes to taxes, we’ll prioritise not the wealthy, but you." The new Duke of Westminster, using family trusts, just avoided paying £3.6 BILLION Inheritance Tax.

Land Tax can't be avoided so no one can avoid paying their fair share. Let's make it happen!
attributes.additional_details:
Duke of Westminster avoids billions in inheritance tax:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/tax/inheritance/inheritance-tax-and-how-the-dukes-of-westminster-avoid-it-on-the/

About Land Tax: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/aug/15/queen-duke-westminster-land-value-tax-distribute-wealth-super-rich

The avoided Inheritance Tax could fund the NHS deficit (£2.45 billion) with a billion pounds to spare:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/20/nhs-in-england-reveals-245bn-record-deficit

attributes.action: Make the documents relating to David Kelly's death public
attributes.background:
David Kelly's death, a UN weapons inspector, shortly followed the WMD inspections in 2003. In 2010, the government deemed the circumstances around his death 'should be kept secret' for 70 years.
Following the Chilcot report today, I feel these documents should be released in the public interest.

attributes.action: The housing crisis is creating homelessness; we need lower rents and more houses
attributes.background: We want the Government to build more houses because the more houses there are, the cheaper they will be. The Government should introduce a new rent cap so that people can afford a house to live in. It's not a laughing matter and the Government cannot let this carry on because it is destroying lives!
attributes.additional_details:
We are class 5 and we are proud to present  Saint Mary's Catholic Primary School's petition. Homelessness is not a problem; it is a crisis. This needs to be addressed immediately.

So we do hope that this turns into reality because homelessness is no joke. How would you feel if you were homeless? Who would you turn to in your hour of need? Why is the Government not taking responsibility for this disturbing crisis? 

Sign this petition today or it could be you living on the streets tomorrow.

attributes.action: Grant Award winning Palestinian peace activist Iyad Burnat a UK visa!
attributes.background: Iyad Burnat is an award winning peace activist. He has,since 2005, led weekly non-violent protests in his village of Bil'in against the Israeli West Bank barrier. His work as a peace activist has allowed him to travel in the US & Europe & we demand that the UK government grant him a visa.

attributes.action: Stop police from passing animal abuse cases to RSPCA for a private prosecution.
attributes.background: This petition is set up to stop UK police forces from passing potential animal abuse cases to the RSPCA for a private prosecution. We strongly believe that if somebody has abused or caused unnecessary suffering to an animal, which is a criminal offence under the animal welfare act 2006,
attributes.additional_details: The police should deal with the case. Such as they do with any other breach of the law. The case should not be passed over to a private charity and become a private case in the eyes of the law.  In recent years there have been many cases were members of the public have had wrongful attempted prosecutions brought upon them. For example, Bob Skinner & Mr Pig in 2015. We believe it is in the best interest of the animals and the public that cases of animal abuse are dealt with by the police from start to finish. Once the case has passed into private hands, what is right and wrong becomes subjective and the lines of the law become blurred, and opinions start to overrule the facts.

attributes.action: Stop Making Tax Digital because it will be hugley burdensome on small businesses
attributes.background: HMRC is pushing ahead with Making Tax Digital: a scheme that will force all business to maintain digital accounts. Currently most small businesses use paper accounting records or spreadsheets. Small businesses lack the skills, time and funding to maintain digital accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what HMRC have said, small businesses will not benefit from MTD. Making Tax Digital is a misnomer because businesses have been filing digital tax returns for 20 years. HMRC would gain from MTD because HMRC would receive more detailed trading information for businesses. Whilst HMRC needs to ensure it collects the correct tax, HMRC completely under estimates the cost of compliance on small businesses.

attributes.action: Make MPs resign if they oppose the will of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.background: The British people vote for their preferred members of parliament every five years. During the five year period of government the average British citizen has little influence over decisions and actions of the government of the day.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not so with those of us who are rich and powerful. These people have the means to influence government decisions through lobbying and legal challenge, both not readily available to the general public.
These methods of changing government actions are a challenge to the democratic processes of a nation and introduce inequality into a democratic society. To meet that challenge and rebalance democracy  this petition asks parliament to introduce a bill that holds members of parliament to immediately resign from office if they are found to be opposing the will of the majority of the constituents they represent."

attributes.action: I want to see a mandatory Driving ban for using a mobile device when driving.
attributes.background: People are being killed on the roads in the UK due to irresponsible motorists using mobile devices whilst driving. The law should be changed to ensure that any motorist using a mobile device whilst driving should receive an automatic driving disqualification of 6 months for a first time offence.
attributes.additional_details: A driver who recently killed three children and a woman whilst he was distracted whilst using his mobile device received a ten year custodial sentence. He had previously been warned about using a mobile device whilst driving by his employers yet he still continued to flout the law.

attributes.action: Provide much needed Truck Stops on the A34 with modern facilities.
attributes.background: The Haulage Industry carries valuable cargo. The A34 needs dedicated Truck stops with advanced facilities e.g CCTV , shower blocks, healthy food outlets. Laybys have no facilties and are a last resort to HGV drivers.Without HGV's our shops would be empty. Drivers deserve a safe secure resting place.
attributes.additional_details: A34 serves our haulage trade out of one of the UK's leading ports, Southampton.The port handles around 14 million tonnes of cargo and 820,000 vehicles per year.With the port expanding by a third, freight on our roads will increase.Already there is inadequate spaces for HGV to park up on their rest times,this will only get worse.Many HGV drivers experience theft of their cargo and fuel, even at a well known service stations.Current services have not grown with the increase of freight on the road.

attributes.action: Make Bullying illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Children are being permanently damaged but the affect of bullying it is morally wrong we as the people should be more vigilant in protecting our youth from the pain and forever damage bullying causes bullying needs to be illegal in all of its area from the simple name calling to the abuse
attributes.additional_details:
a on going debate on whether it should be illegal http://www.debate.org/opinions/should-bullying-be-illegal

http://www.teenink.com/opinion/school_college/article/331577/Should-There-Be-a-Law-Against-Bullying/

attributes.action: Military personnel to have military hearing before they proceed to civil courts.
attributes.background: In the past any suggestion of wrong doing by military personnel was investigated by the military - if any was discovered and thought to be serious enough it was passed to the civil courts to deal with.

attributes.action: Stop Sodexo from closing Katie's Kitchen
attributes.background: Katie's kitchen is a food van that his been running for over 20 years and now is being shut down by the greed of Sodexo. Katie's kitchen has given joy to surviving soldiers for many many years by coming out on exercise and saving the troops from the rotting stomach of ration packs
attributes.additional_details: Sodexo food is over priced and under quality. They will double the price of Katie's kitchen and they don't want any competition

attributes.action: EU citizens to not be allowed to vote in any Scottish independence referendum
attributes.background: EU citzens should not be allowed to vote in future Scottish Referendums it be for Scottish/Scottish living outside Scotland only.

attributes.action: change the EHC plan to cover disabled students in higher education to 24 years
attributes.background: My son is autistic. We was told that he would have support in education up to the age of 24. He did extremely well at collage and got an overall exam result of merit merit, he got a place in his local Uni only to find that the support he had had in college would cease, just like the EHC plan.
attributes.additional_details: My son although very intelligent in his field, struggles enormously in social situations and becomes anxious and upset with new experiences, people, environments. With the 1:1  support that he had, he managed to cope with college life and did very well there, but he aspired to go to uni to follow his dream. His EHC plan stopped because it didn't  cover higher education. My son is the same person he was before. We are trying to get support for him now from the council but keep hitting barriers

attributes.action: Ask UK Government to Guarantee the UK membership to the European Research Area.
attributes.background: British Universities in particular benefit from participation in European projects. Access to grants and colleagues from across the EU is vital to our universities and our science. We get out more than we put in. Why lose it?
attributes.additional_details:
UK universities in particular benefit hugely from participation in pan European projects and need reassurance from the Government that will continue. Access to the European Research Area is vital to British science and future generations. A recent parliamentary report strongly backed this position. In the future it could be possible for British business to benefit in the same way as universities. 
 
http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201516/ldselect/ldsctech/127/127.pdf

attributes.action: Hold a public vote on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model
attributes.background: In June the UK electorate voted to leave the EU by a narrow majority. It has since become clear that there was no clear plan defined and little information given about the options. A public decision can only be valid if a clear intent of the direction the government wishes to take us is proposed.
attributes.additional_details:
The outcome of the advisory referendum on 23rd June means that the government must now propose defined exit plans for terms of leaving the EU.

However, leaving the EU is too momentous a decision to proceed without a clear understanding of the proposed model.

We call for a public vote to be held before Article 50 is invoked, on the options for the future UK/EU (and global) trade model with impartial assessments of the consequences of each option, including the option of staying in the EU.

attributes.action: Ensure all apprentices are paid the National Minimum Wage for their age.
attributes.background: The current rate is £3.40 per hour as of October 2016, (rising to £3.50 as of April 2017)  for apprentices aged 16 to 18 and those aged 19 or over who are in their first year. All other apprentices are entitled to the National Minimum Wage for their age)
attributes.additional_details:
Apprentices who earn just £3.40 an hour are struggling to make ends meet.  This wage is not financially viable.  In addition, an apprentice can spend a high proportion of their wage travelling to work.  
Apprentices should be paid National Minimum Wage from the start. 
Apprenticeships can be an important way for young people to get into employment and earn while they learn. But young workers should not be used as cheap labour.  All young people deserve to be paid a decent minimum wage.

attributes.action: Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow the electorate to dismiss MPs
attributes.background:
Amend the recall of parliament act 2015 to allow for fresh elections when 40% of the last turnout at a constituency election signs a petition calling for that.

The British public demand the means to remove our MPs if they are not acting in the interest of the British people
attributes.additional_details:
For far too long, prospective members of parliament and political parties of all denominations, have lied to the British public in order to get elected. 

The only way to ensure that those elected to office, keep their word once chosen to speak for the people, is to give the public the right to sack their MPs or government in much the same way that you would sack a negligent or under performing employee.

Many MP's are openly disregarding the will of the people and should therefore be removed.

attributes.action: UK GOVERNMENT TO ACTIVELY PURSUE URGENT PEACE NEGOTIATIONS IN SYRIA
attributes.background: How long will this unrelentless suffering, mass destruction  and massacre of innocent lives continue to be silenced, ignored and accepted by the international community ?
attributes.additional_details:
After six years the Syrian civil war is increasing with rage  with no end in sight. 
Since the  war began, as many as 386,000 people have been killed, including nearly 14,000 children.  The war has become more deadly since foreign powers have joined the conflict.  The only way to end this catastrophe is for the world to stand together and remove Assad and his regime. 

Eastern Aleppo has become the key strategic battleground and an epitome of this brutal, barbaric and morally shameless and tragic war in Syria.  It has been besieged, bombed, starved and strangled as part of the Assad’s regime ‘Starve or Kneel’ strategy. 

Let's show the innocent children of Syria and its people that their lives do matter, that we do care and the world has not forgotten!

attributes.action: The UK must ratify the Paris Agreement on climate change immediately
attributes.background: At COP21 in December of 2015 real progress was made in creating global agreement for a low carbon future. For these agreements to be legally binding 55 countries representing 55% of global emissions must ratify the Paris Agreement. The US and China have just ratified- the UK must follow suit.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK represents 1,55% of global emissions, so its signature would make a tangible difference
http://unfccc.int/paris_agreement/items/9444.php

http://climateanalytics.org/hot-topics/ratification-tracker.html

We stand a real chance for progress now China and the US have signed (the worlds two biggest emitters by far).
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-37265541

attributes.action: Monitoring in pregnancy for every woman who has received cervical treatments
attributes.background:
Myself & my fiancé lost our beautiful baby boy, Oscar, after he was born prematurely at 24 weeks. 
My waters broke due to an incompetent cervix that was never checked or monitored despite having part of my cervix removed after a Lletz procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of cells that were removed from my cervix were classified as low risk and therefore no further monitoring or checks were made during pregnancy. Had I been monitored my incompetent cervix would have been diagnosed and our perfect son may be here today. 
I am petitioning for every pregnant woman who has undergone any type of treatment compromising their cervix to be monitored during their pregnancy to prevent baby losses like ours occurring in the future.

attributes.action: Stop Yorkshire Ambulance Services plan to downgrade Honely Ambulance Station.
attributes.background: YAS intend to reduce the cover at Honley Ambulance Station. We believe this will have serious implications for the public.The plans will leave the area devoid of cover for long periods of time.We are asking for your support to protect the service that we provide for the local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Staffing levels are to be reduced by 40% which will result in a 50% decrease in ambulance and rapid response vehicle cover. The area covered by this station includes the Holme, Colne, Dearne Valleys and the Huddersfield area.  The planned reduction to 1 ambulance crew 24/7 will mean this area will be without emergency cover for long periods of time. Statistics show that a high % of life threatening time critical emergency calls are already not achieved due to a lack of available resources.
